briefTitle: Administration of Ketamine to Prevent the Post-operative Pain
officialTitle: Effect of Ketamine, at the Induction and Its Maintenance to Prevent the Post-operative Pain: Clinical Trial in Cancerology
summary: The surgery of breast cancer is responsible for post-operative pain, needing in about 30% some morphine consumption; like that, the association of ketamine with general anaesthesia may decrease morphine's use and so its adverse effects. The purpose is to evaluate the analgesic effect of a receptor NMDA's antagonist ( ketamine)
